concept.title: Util.getQueryParam
concept.shortdesc: Returns the value of a specified query string parameter, if found in the current page URL or in the provided string.

conbody.p: Because important data (such as campaign tracking codes, internal search keywords, etc.) is available in the query string on a page, getQueryParam helps capture the data into Analytics variables.
conbody.note: The syntax for the utility differs from the syntax for the plug-in.

row.entry: (required) The name of the query string parameter that you want to get. This parameter is case sensitive.
(optional) Default url is s.pageURL or window.location. Specifying a value for this parameter overrides the URL from which the query parameter is retrieved to the one specified.
(optional) Parameter delimiter in the URL. Default delimiter is "&". This lets you to specify an alternate query-string delimiter, such as ";".

conbody.p: This function returns the value of the query-string variable or an empty string if it's not found.
